newsitem.title: GERMANY: Viag - no plans to buy IAW minority shares.
newsitem.headline: Viag - no plans to buy IAW minority shares.

text.p: German diversified utility Viag AG said on Tuesday that it had no plans to buy minority shares in the utility Isar-Amperwerke AG.

Speaking at Isar-Amperwerke's (IAW) annual meeting, Georg Obermeier, management board chairman of Viag and supervisory board chairman of IAW, said that a payout to buy IAW minority shares was "not currently being considered".
Viag unit Bayernwerk, also a utility based in Bavaria, has been trying since May to secure a majority stake in IAW and a decision is still awaited from the German cartel office.
Obermeier said that the monopoly watchdog had extended the decision-making period until May.
Earlier in the day, the management board chairman of IAW said that a takeover by Bayernwerk would lead to a host of possible savings at IAW, which would come from cooperation with the Viag unit.
